Material used.Description: Recombinant synuclein proteins (wild-type and mutants) were used to test PLD2 inhibition activity.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant showed significantly higher PLD2 inhibition compared to wild-type.
A53T mutant exhibited stronger PLD2 inhibition than wild-type.
Phosphorylation of A30P reduced PLD2 inhibition activity.
Phosphorylation of A53T altered PLD2 inhibition dynamics.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type synuclein proteins served as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Phosphorylation-deficient mutants were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: PLD2 inhibition activity within baseline range of wild-type proteins.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: PLD2 inhibition activity exceeding 20% of wild-type baseline.

Approved assay.Description: PLD2 inhibition assays are commonly used in Parkinson's disease research.
